Reviews.Title: “Smell what you eat”
Reviews.Author: Ionela M
Reviews.Content: Hy. I stayed at Lloret 3 nights – 4 days. The biggest plus is the location – you practically step out into La Rambla and the Catalunya subway station is at 5 minutes away, also Mc, Burger King and Carrefour Market are neighbors of the hotel. The room was for three people – one “double” bed (not so big) and one single. It was clean, it was warm, hot water running, walls as thick as a piece of paper (!) – generally I don’t have why to complain about the room. The breakfast –there was a problem – although it was rich for a one star hotel (cereals, ham, fruits, pastry, etc) – the pastry was stinky – literally – the muffins smelled awful. My advice: smell before eating. Once again – a big thumbs up for the location. Happy holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Great service in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: 60dragons
Reviews.Content: We found ourselves stranded in Barcelona on the day of the national strike when our hire car failed to materialise. By that time we'd checked out of our original accommodation and hastily booked into the Hotel Lloret. Initially we were given an apartment in a side street which was definitely in need of an update. We opted to pay a bit more (and were lucky enough to have an upgrade too) to one of the newly refurbished rooms on the first floor. It was very comfortable and spacious and the bathroom was a really good size too. The breakfast was good - basic continental, but there was everything you could have wanted. The staff were great - really helpful and welcoming. Location is superb - easy access to transport to and from the airport, close to the tourist buses, handy for the beaches and right in the centre of everything. As the hotel is currently being refurbished there was sometimes a bit of noise from the builders during the day and a lot of half-finished works but nothing too intrusive, but if our room was anything to go by then it should be fab when it's finished. The real bonuses for us were free internet use, free safety deposit boxes, being able to leave all our bags for free after we'd checked out and being able to sit on the balconies watching all the action in La Rambla. I'd definitely recommend this hotel and I'd stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location but...”
Reviews.Author: cedangeles
Reviews.Content: The week of Feb 27 was a bad time to be in Barcelona because of the Global Telecom conference which brought about 70,000 people into the city. Our favorite hotel charged three times its usual rate. We managed to get a reasonably-priced room in Hotel Lloret which was a bit cramped and faced a side street. The noise was unbearable. Thankfully, we brought ear plugs which helped. Breakfast was decent, there was WiFi, and water pressure was good. Basic but acceptable.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Dori12
Reviews.Content: The hotel's location was our reason for choosing it, though it was listed as one-star hotel. It turned out that the hotel is in a process of renovation and probably will have a changed number of stars soon. Our room was already renovated and quite pleasant. From the width of the doors and of the bathroom I guess it was designed to be wheel-chair accessible. A new elevator will be functioning from March 2012 so all of the comments regading the hotel being not accessible for people with walking difficulties will be iirelevant. Our room overlooked a courtyard so I can't say how noisy the rooms overlooking La Rambla are. On the other hand I would bear some noise in return to the view over the most famous street in Barcelona. The only thing missing in the room was a minibar but that was not a problem from our point of view. The location of the hotel is really great. It's right next to Catalunya Square where the bus from the airport stops. It's near the Tourist Buses' Stop and it's within a walking distance to a lot of sights and to a lot of good places to eat (not on La Rambla, you'd better skip those). It's also very close to La Boqueria market - a must-visit in Barcelona. The price included a breakfast which was good enough. The only problem was that the breakfast room tended to get full at certain hours and you might have to wait a little for a table. The people at the reception were all very kind and helpful. I would deifinitely recommend this hotel, easpecally if your stay in Barcelona is not very long - the location helps you make the most of your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good location & price”
Reviews.Author: Arodasv
Reviews.Content: Good location, good price. Single room was small, but perfect for just sleeping. Undergoing renovations.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Mediocre Sleep”
Reviews.Author: finnadian
Reviews.Content: This hotel, right on Las Ramblas in Barcelona, can't be beat for location. Placa Catalunya is right outside your door, which is fantastic, and all of Barcelona's best shopping is right around the corner. The metro is at your door as well with it being at P. Catalunya. The hotel is clean and functional, making it a perfect place for those just looking for an inexpensive place to sleep. They are in the process of putting in a new elevator that will serve the entirety of the hotel. The desk staff were very friendly and efficient. Because of it's proximity to P. Catalunya, it is easily accesible from the airport via the Aerobus, which only costs 5 euro 30, which is way cheaper than a taxi or AeroCity. As much as the hotel was functional and in a superb location, my stay was sort of offset by the fact that the noise from the street was horrible...perhaps because I checked in on a Saturday, the night noise was elevated...however it was easily the most noise I've ever experienced in a hotel. I did notice that in my particular room the balcony door didn't seal properly and there were 2 cracks in the bottom that were wide enough that a bit of air flowed in, so these two minor deficiencies probably didn't help in keeping the noise out. But overall, I think the windows/doors desperately need to be replaced because there is so much noise, given it's the busiest street in Barcelona. I've read reviews of this hotel where some have said the noise was unbearable and some have said it was fine, so maybe it depends on the room you get. All I know is that I had to have my iPod on all night to drown out the noise. All in all, if you're willing to put up with night time noise from the streets to have a cheap bed in a great location, this hotel is for you. If you value your sleep like I do, maybe look for a hotel a little more off the beaten track.

Reviews.Title: “Functional”
Reviews.Author: Lukeyg7
Reviews.Content: The location is fantastic, but the hotel is very basic - luckily in Barcelona there are a lot of things to do and you don't have to spend too much time in your room. Perfect for a bed for the night,

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location for a city break”
Reviews.Author: meg d
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in december and loved it...right at the top of las ramblas we were walking distance to everything! right around the corner from regular buses to the airport. Not too noisy either considering we were on the busiest street. Lots of market stalls along las ramblas...lovely! Place was spotless. Staff didnt have much english so couldn't provide much info but there was free wifi, computer access and plenty of brochures.

Reviews.Title: “mixed reviews”
Reviews.Author: jportphil
Reviews.Content: The hotel location was fantastic,about the stairs there was no problem for us because we just brought light traveling bags. The room was ok but the toilet bowl was like when you sat it was moving were afraid that maybe it will broke!and there was a" cockroach" in the bathroom!!!,the headboard and the side table was full of dust.Was so noisy all night you can hear people shooting outside. The recepcionist was so helpfull he gave us all the direction we needed.Breakfast was ok.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, service and price!”
Reviews.Author: daisy2011
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at the Hotel Lloret for 4 nights in the end of December. The first thing which pleasantly surprised us was an excellent location of the hotel. It is situated just in the centre of Barcelona,very close to airbus stop, touristic bus service, metro station and shops.The hotel staff was very helpful. There is PC in the hall and you can use it to go on the internet. Wi-fi is available in all rooms. Also, there is a luggage room which is very convenient, because our flight was in the evening and we left our suitcases there. Our room was small, but very clean and cosy. The bathroom was nice. Towels were changed every day. Breakfast was basic, but sufficient for us. We were not disappointed with this hotel and recommend it for active tourists who need the hotel just for sleeping.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: _kiwibird_059
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location, service and rooms. Really good value for money for such a great location, the staff were helpful and the breakfast was tasty. My room had just been renovated so the bathroom was really nice and new. The room was a little noisy at night due to the location next to La Ramblas - so maybe not good if you are a light sleeper. Free internet provided and never had to wait too long to use it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: lesleycampbell
Reviews.Content: We stayed from the 30th December for 5 nights - We had a room overlooking the front of the hotel. The hotel staff were friendly and efficient. The room was very clean and there were fresh towels every day.The breakfast was fine plenty to eat - I would definately go back to this hotel and would recommend the hotel to others. Thank you Hotel Lloret !

Reviews.Title: “"We had the best time in the Hotel Lloret"”
Reviews.Author: enriquebarton
Reviews.Content: “ The hotel Lloret staff went out of their way to make us feel comfortable and could not have been friendlier! Our room was set out to a very high standard and was spacious and comfortable. The hotel is one minute walk from Plaza Cataluna, right in front of paseo Las Ramblas. Also five minutes from famous fresh market La Boqueria. It has a very comfortable atmosphere. Very nice breakfast. We highly recommend this hotel....

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: Desnjen
Reviews.Content: We stayed four nights at the Hotel Lloret in September. We arrived at about 3pm and were told our room wouldn't be ready for about half an hour which it was but we were told we would need to move rooms the next morning. No problem as we were out most of the day but when we came back around 4pm our new room still wasn't ready so we had another wait which was frustrating. Both rooms were Superior rooms, very nicely presented and very comfortable. The first looked out onto an internal courtyard and the second had a balcony overlooking the side street with side views to the Ramblas. That hiccup aside our stay was very enjoyable, the rooms were very comfortable and outfitted to a high standard, well worth the extra money. Breakfast was buffet style continental and very adequate. The staff were at all times polite friendly and helpful. I asked where to get a cab to collect our rental car and it was pointed out that across the road which is divided by the Ramblas would be best because it would mean a much cheaper taxi fare by avoiding the one way street at the front which went the wrong way! Hotel Lloret is in a wonderful location, right on the Ramblas about 50 metres from Catalunya Square and surrounded by shops, bars and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “If your tastes are humble this can´t be beat for location & VALUE!!”
Reviews.Author: DHIIPAK
Reviews.Content: I always go here when visiting Barcelona, one of europes best walking cities. It´s about 300 meters from the central Placa de Catalunya, with all the related metro stations, airport bus stop and prime real estate of the Passeig de Gracia (Gaudi buildings) . But the real attractioon here is the Ramblas....probable the best strolling & people watching boulevard in Europe (ending at the sea and continuing on to the fantastic Barcelona acquarium. The fantastic Barrio Gotico (Gothic barrio) is across the street. HOWEVER, keep to the left side of the Rambla (as you descend) to explore the side streets; as the right side (i.e., behind this hotel) is the Barrio Chino -- which can be crime ridden with drugs, prostitution, etc. And whenever on the Rambla, watch for pickpockets ! BE WARNED, this hotel´s rooms are small, with just enough space for the very basic twin beds. So if you want 4-star rooms please go ahead and look (PAY $$) elsewhere. I always request one of the balcony rooms facing the Rambla and look forward to sitting there with a drink each night (i.e., beer bought at the nearby store) watching the real life street theater unfold. If you choose this option too, ALSO BE WARNED that you may get some street noise (sirens, garbage truck and loud groups walking home from the bars); but as I´m a sound sleeper I get through this OK. However, if you attack Barcelona with gusto you´ll be out on your feet ALL day and will be REAL tired upon return each night -- falling asleep before your head hits the pillow. The owners & staff are VERY friendly, helpful and unpretentious as the property. It´s actually undergone some very nice renovations since I began staying here in 1992 (new bathrooms, room decoration and now WiFi in rooms). Single rooms start at 50 euros/ night--with doubles about 74.

Reviews.Title: “a nice hotel with excellent locaion”
Reviews.Author: Ming-Wen C
Reviews.Content: It is a small but clean Hotel. The location simply can't be better. It is located at Las Ramblas，near Placa de Catalunya. The price is reasonable，and a wonderful breakfast is included. You can have your breakfast in the balcony, watching the quiet street in the morning, in contrast to the noise and excitement of the day. Therefore，you had better ask for a room not near Las Ramblas. The owners are very nice people who will help you with anything you need, although sometimes they are busy. If I visit Barcelona again, I will go back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best Location”
Reviews.Author: Chai85
Reviews.Content: In Barcelona, what you need is Location of your Hotel. Lloret is right on Catalunya square towards the end of Ramblas Street. It's always bustling with crowd, artists, tapas restaurants, hop on- hop off bus stop very close by, everything around is walking distance. It's a perfect stay to enjoy the city conveniently. Lloret Hotel has good rooms especially the Superior Rooms. Though the staircases are very narrow, but it doesn't matter as long as the rooms are clean. I recommend the superior rooms. The receptionists are very hospitable. We needed to pre-pone our flight tickets and they helped us so well in working that out. Internet is free. They have wifi too and anyone can use their laptop free of charge. Breakfast is good too. This hotel is highly recommendable for those who are looking at a good stay and enjoy the outdoors. They have luggage storage free and it's safe. Hence I saw a lot of plus points to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Position, position, position!”
Reviews.Author: GlenysValmae
Reviews.Content: Booked a double room 6 weeks in advance, got 2 singles. The room was clean, good bathroom, and breakfast included. We thought the breakfast was great, yoghurt, fruit, bread to toast, cereal, ham, cheese, cakes, croissants, coffee. The beds have rubber underlays which are very hot. The hotel is right on the Ramblas, and has small tables on the balcony, so you can sit and watch all the action. You exit the train station at Plaza Catalunya turn to your left and there it is! 89 euros a night, we thought this was a great bargain and plan to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for us”
Reviews.Author: Tonypet1
Reviews.Content: Location is fantastic and very convenient. We came from the airport and took bus A1 to Plaza Catalunya. It's a very short walk from there. We were given room 102 which is facing La Ramblas. It is a nice room that has airconditioning, double bed, a closet to keep our things and a nice bathroom. We can hear a little bit of noise from the street but nothing that really bothered our sleep. Breakfast was breads, cheese, ham, fruits, cereals, juice and coffee. The young lady at the reception was very nice. Too bad I didn't get her name.

Reviews.Title: “Nice & Clean, Budget Satay!”
Reviews.Author: Larisa2010
Reviews.Content: Great location ...right in the middle of the action.I booked this hotel based on reviews...and i was looking for something clean, great location and not too expensive. It was a great choise. Especially if you are coming from the Airport there is Aero bus going back and forward every 20 min. It will cost you arond 5 Euro to get to hotel. Great place to stay, breakfast was good. Room was small but clean...and i hope ,if you are going to Barcelona, you are not going to spend any time inside a room! Because the spirit on th street is worth to experience! After we checked out we wereeven to leave our luggage on the fron deck while we went to brouse a little bit more before our cruise. If you are going to cruise, the taxi to the port will cost you around 10.euro. Great budget choice!

Reviews.Title: “LOUD! and under construction”
Reviews.Author: craggcravings
Reviews.Content: To the Lloret's defense we did choose to stay on Las Ramblas during Saint John's festival. But in all my travels I have never stayed in a louder hotel!!! We went to bed late, were woken up every 15 minutes to fireworks seemingly right outside our window, and finally just got up at 4am to join the party in the streets since we weren't sleeping at all. Even without the festival the hotel was under construction and not very nice. Take a walk on Las Ramblas, but I wouldn't recommend staying there. We moved to a rented apartment the second day and would recommend that instead. Barcelona is easy to navigate and there is no need to stay right in the center of the tourist area when a metro can get you there easily from anywhere in the city.

Reviews.Title: “It's a shame it's so rundown.”
Reviews.Author: mrsmc91
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Hotel Lloret Ramblas for 3 nights in July. The view is amazing from the balcony but sad to say the good comments stop there. The hotel is extemely run down and badly in need of some TLC! It is a lovely building but seriously needs painting on the outside balcony doors. The balcony is traditionally small but you can hardly stand out on it for the 1970's aircon box and a big dirty plastic bottle to catch any water. The rooms have 2 poor wee single beds and a tiny cupboard and even smaller bathroom. We had to move one off the beds to get the balcony door open. This hotel is not worth what they charge . Honestly the only plus is the location!!!

Reviews.Title: “Oh the nightmare! Stay away!”
Reviews.Author: lelei76
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Lloret Ramblas, upon the insistence of a friend with whom I was traveling because of the great location. But the location comes with all of the late night noise you might expect from the partying on the Ramblas right in front of the hotel. I stayed in three rooms at Hotel Lloret over three nights and was very disappointed. The first room had a dirty bathroom with flies, and I was up until4 AM due to the noise outside because Barca had lost (lucky for me). The second room was supposed to be a "superior room" with internet and was priced considerably higher. It was much nicer but there was no internet, and I had work to do. I was told someone would come the next day, but that I could use a desk in the hallway behind the kitchen for the wifi. I sat there and used VOIP to communicate with work. As I was sitting there on an important call, the same person who told me I could sit there since my room did not have wifi walked by with a couple of men to show them one of the other supposedly superior rooms and started yelling at me in Spanish (I am bilingual) that they could not have a woman sitting in the common area speaking with such force. I had to interrupt my call to tell him that I was on the phone and had no choice but to sit there because they did not give me a room for wifi, which was guaranteed. Later, he decided to call my room to apologize and said he would have someone come to fix the wifi first thing in the morning (btw, wifi is pronouced weefee there). I told him they just needed a second router for that side of the building (if my husband had been there he could have fixed it in 5 minutes). The next morning I spoke with the front desk about the wifi and was told no one was coming or had been requested to come because it was good Friday, so the guy had lied to me to boot. Plus, I was thoroughly exhausted because the superior room was tucked on the main floor behind the breakfast room and kitchen, so the clanking of plates and glasses began around 6 AM, while the revelry outside on the ramblas quieted around 4. The nicer front desk-man moved me to another superior room on a higher floor that had literally just been finished. There was construction dust everywhere in the hallway and the door did not even have a handle! The nightmare continued, but at least I finally had wi-fi and a quiet room. In short, I would not recommend this hotel to anyone I liked.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: JennRu
Reviews.Content: This hotel puts you just off the Cataluna Square and is close to almost everything. Even la Sagrada Familia is just a 20 minute stroll along Barcelona's gorgeous boulevards. I had a street side room and had some difficulty sleeping one night because the soccer team had just one a big competition and everyone was partying all night along the Ramblas.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and Clean Budget Hotel in La Rambla”
Reviews.Author: MarjTravelExp
Reviews.Content: This hotel is the cheapest hotel amongst las ramblas. It has access to everything you need such as neighbouring attractions like Barri Gothic, Paseig de Gracia, Barceloneta, La Pedrera, port beach and many more. It's located just right by the Catalunya Square. I will definitely go back there as I had a pleasant stay without any issues from the neighbours and the loud noises outside La Rambla. La Rambla is very loud during day and night. If you have your windows open you can definitely hear people and cars outside but if you close your windows you can't hear anything from outside. The service is good :) You can find out more about Hotel Lloret and also see lots of photos which I've taken during my holiday. http://www.marjtravelexperiences.com/2011/08/where-to-stay-in-la-rambla-barcelona.html

Reviews.Title: “good location....”
Reviews.Author: akinahd
Reviews.Content: we stayed 4 nights in Sep 2010. It was easy to find, right at the edge of plaza catalunya. once you get off from the airport shuttle, hotel is walking distance. also, it is very near to the metro station and few buses are running in front of the hotel. it was a great privilege when you are exhausted after a long day. facilities in the hotel are quite satisfactory, except the breakfast. rooms are spacious and clean. staff was very friendly. reception is at the first floor. so yu might find bit lost, once you enter from the main door at ground floor. many cafes and restaurants are locate in the vicinity..so problem with food at all. also there is a carrefour at the next door !

Reviews.Title: “Simple hotel / great location”
Reviews.Author: RuAlAmsterdam
Reviews.Content: This is a simple and clean hotel directly on the Ramblas in downtown Barcelona. Great for a quick stay but if your room is at the front of the hotel be prepared for some street noise. The breakfast is simple but there are enough other places to grab a quick brunch if you're looking for something more substantial. The elevator is not well designed as you need to go up a flight of stairs before you get there. You can take the bus from the airport and from there it is just a short walk to the hotel

Reviews.Title: “Met and exceeded my expectation!”
Reviews.Author: colombian Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel is basic but in the best location in Las Ramblas. Its right on Las Ramblas and across the Plaza Catalunya where you can take the Aero bus, its great, you get it at the airport and it drops you off at the door of the Hotel. It was so convenient that I never felt stressed while going to catch a flight. The people at the Hotel are very respectful, the rooms are spacey and clean. Get a room with the view to Las Ramblas as you can visualize the Barcelona 24/7 life.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised.”
Reviews.Author: Mooney6461
Reviews.Content: We were in Barcelona only one night. I wanted to be off La Rambla or with a couple of blocks. I read the reviews on this site and decided that I would try it given the fact that people commented on the location being perfect. It is!! We had a upgraded room. It's basically a regular room that recently had renovation. Worth the extra $20 a night. All the rooms have three twin beds. We ordered a fourth one with an extra charge. The room was quiet small with the extra bed but we were going to be out pretty much all evening. The beds were quite comfortable, the bathroom, recently renovated was spotless. My husband who is 6'3" said it was the first European shower where he didn't have to do the limbo. The room was clean. Anyone who doesn't care if it the most basic of rooms and wants a perfect spot on La Rambla should give Hotel Lloret a try.

Reviews.Title: “more than i expected”
Reviews.Author: barbaraMiddlesbrough Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: location couldnt be better! nice clean rooms , breakfast continental, and nice surroundings .would definately go again

Reviews.Title: “Great basic hotel in a fab location”
Reviews.Author: beegeeUk
Reviews.Content: Great location - right in the middle of La Ramblas and a great base to get to many of the other famous sights of Barcelona. The hotel was very basic, but when you are on holiday you only need it for sleeping at the end of the night! We hardly spent any time in the hotel, we were busy out exploring this great city! Rooms were clean and breakfast was ok, continental style but enough to give you a good start to the day. Only slight thing was the steps, certainly made me much fitter walking up to the 2nd floor!! We walked from the Estacio Del Nord bus station (having flown in to Girona) and it was a nice easy 20min walk! Also the gelato shop next to hotel (altho expensive) was mega yummy and you could have as many flavours as u wanted in one cone! The free wifi in room was a good bonus too!

Reviews.Title: “Great Base”
Reviews.Author: Polotravellers
Reviews.Content: My wife and I decided to stay at the LLoret because of its central location and the fact that we did not need a luxury hotel. We were not disappointed. The hotel staff were friendly and answered any questions with a smile! The hotel was clean and tidy and our double standard room, although small, was clean and smelled fresh. We had a small balcony overlooking the Las Ramblas which is busy all through the night as well as daytime. Each room has an individual air conditioning unit fitted in one of the fixed doors to the balcony. With the doors closed and airconditioning on, the sound of the Ramblas is dampened somewhat and sleeping is easier!!! The self service breakfast was basic but sufficient, consisting of cakes and pastries, yogurt, toast, cereal, fruit tea coffee, fruit juice. The room, food area, utensils and crockery were very clean. If you want a base for seeing Barcelona then the Lloret is great you can get anywhere easily. The airport shuttle is only 5 mins walk away. All in all it was good value for money. We will return :-)

Reviews.Title: “Good value in great location”
Reviews.Author: ENielsen
Reviews.Content: This hotel was professional and the service was excellent. The room was basic and small but super clean and comfortable with a very good bed (firm) and everything you need incl WIFI. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “great location but can be noisy”
Reviews.Author: daintonbabe
Reviews.Content: we had 3 great nights there, staff friendly ,breakfast ok, bit like cafe in breakfast room. location of our room looked right on la rambla on third floor, room was very clean but a little dated, shutters on windows hanging on with one hinge, clean towels daily and bathroom spotless. We didn't realise on last night of our stay barcelona and madrid was playing, film crew from local news were set up ready for the celabration if they win that evening, has they celabrate at the font right outside the hotel, as i crossed my fingers they wouldn't score only because we were having a early night as we had to be up at 4am to catch our flight, but hey they won and they certainly know how to celabrate! upto 3am there were hundreds outside chanting horns blowing flares bangers going off, well no sleep but a unforgetable night :-) very busy time to go but lovely area. very central for everything. Oh and one last thing the lift was worse than a ride at Alton towers, did get quite fit using stairs.

Reviews.Title: “Tis hotel enjoys an excellent location and is clean.”
Reviews.Author: Yanmike
Reviews.Content: A friend and I arrived late in the evening. We had been promised twin beds but the room had a double. When we complained a nice man came immediately and brought a new single bed and extra towels, giving us 3 sets!. He was very obliging. The location can't be bettered, but it makes for a noisy experience as this city never sleeps. The air conditioning was noisy so we slept (or tried to) without it. The room was very small, made even smaller by the extra bed, and the bathroom was miniscule and had no means of extraction, but very nice fluffy towels. However, everything was immaculately clean and it looked as if it had been decorated recently. Breakfast on the balcony overlooking the Rambla was a delight and the food was adequate. But the coffee was from a machine. This spoils things in so many lower grade hotels. We only spent one night there. But for anyone on a budget it is ideal, as long as you can manage on minimum sleep!

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Shame about the noise!!”
Reviews.Author: HappyJim09 Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: This is a great little hotel in a brilliant location.The beds were ultra clean and we had fresh towels daily. Unfortunately we must have got the smallest room in the hotel (room 217). We had to press our backs to the wall to get past the edge of the beds, which was fun at first but gradually got on your nerves as the week past. Especially if you had to use the bathroom in the middle of the night...The breakfast is adequate. Continental style and you can eat all you want....... Be warned........ There is building work being done at the moment and we couldn't spend any time during the day in our room because of the noise. It was right below our room, so we could feel the bed shake with each hammer blow. Would I recommend it???? Yes when the building work is done. You cannot beat the location. The cleanliness and many 3/4 star hotels don't give fresh towels daily

Reviews.Title: “Small Hotel on La Rambla”
Reviews.Author: hkmny
Reviews.Content: Hotel Lloret is located on La Rambla, so once you walk outside, there are tons of bars and restaurants in the area. It's a great location, however it definitely gets loud in the room until late hours of the night--the hotel windows and walls are thin. The front desk staff is very nice and helpful--they will go out of their way to help you find sites, laundry, etc in Barcelona. You do have to walk up a very narrow flight of stairs between the ground floor and the lobby, and the elevator up to the rooms is ridiculously small--common in Europe budget hotels. The rooms and bathrooms are also tiny, but have good fast wifi connections. There are vending machines near the hotel lobby, and an area to watch tv. If you can deal with the noise at night, I think Hotel Lloret is a good budget hotel in Barcelona, since you can easily get to most places in the city from here.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for City Break”
Reviews.Author: ZitaL
Reviews.Content: My Husnand and I stayed in Hotel Lloret in Feb 11 tor a three day city break. This hotel totally met our needs. The location is fantastic... Right on the Rambala, close metro, airportt bus stop, tour bus stop - Couldn't have adked for better.... Rooms are VERY basic but spotless clean. Continental breakfast was included in rate, nothing too spectacular but enough to start you off for the day. Fantastic room rate for such a great location. Would totally recommend for price concious ciity break travellers - Great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Brilliant!”
Reviews.Author: LSAS19
Reviews.Content: Loved this little place! Hotel Lloret was such a great little hotel and suited our needs to a T. The hotel itself has got the most perfect location, everything to visit Barcelona is on your doorstep. The tour buses, the Metro station, the aerobus just over the road and of course, La Rambla! The famous street itself has countless restaurants, cafes and bars and is great to just have a stroll. The hotel is very very clean and well kept. The rooms are more than adequate. We had a bath as well as a shower which is great after a long day of walking. The TV had more than 50 channels, a couple of which in English. Our room was 211 and had a side view of La Rambla, which did affect our quality of sleep but we simply appreciated our location and bought earplugs! On any hotel on La Rambla, you would make use of earplugs. Another little issue we had was the heating. We couldn't turn the radiator off which made the room very hot. The Spanish must think 15-16 degrees winter is freezing cold, whereas us Scots.. it doesn't get much hotter in the summer! It wasn't a giant problem for us just a little annoying. The breakfast consisted of yoghurt, cereal, tea, coffee, orange juice, breakfast muffins, croissants, fruit, etc.. which was nice as you look forward to a big lunch & dinner. The staff at the hotel were very helpful and eager to fulfill your needs. I 100% recommend this hotel. Its such a great little place to use as your base for visiting this beautiful city. Overall we loved it and would happily stay here if visiting Barcelona in the future. I also recommend the Barcelona bus tour, we did the blue tour (City Sightseeing Company) which took us round the Sagrada Familia and Park Guell. Also a trip to La Boqueria market is a must! It is well known that La Ramblas, especially, has more than its fair share of pick-pockets. Fortunately, we were not targetted which I imagine was helped by being very aware of everyone around us. Any questions about the hotel/Barcelona, please don't hesitate to send me a message & I'll try my best to answer your queries.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, very cheap”
Reviews.Author: Agrilo
Reviews.Content: Very good location in La Rambla near Plaça de Catalunia. The single room is very small with a small bed and by night is very noisy so I suggest the use of earplugs. Very good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location at the best value in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: redariel
Reviews.Content: For reasons unclear to me Lloret has not been mentioned much in Rick Steves books in a few years. It is the bible as far as Europe goes but this hotel is a wonderful value. It is a Spanish hotel and English is variable but why go to Spain to hear English. I always get a balcony which is loud but great to look out . If you want peace and quiet get a back room. The hotel is old but immaculately clean and very laid back about coming and going , guests et cet. they are helpful with storing luggage. the optional breakfast is ok but given the Spanish night owl atmosphere you might not want to wake up for it. The people are friendly and it is a 100 m from Le Meridien with a better view and the smiles are sincere and not purchased. There is a community refrigerator and I just get bread meat and cheese at the local super mercado then eat when I want. I have stayed at much fancier hotels but for the price Llloret can't be beat. I can't wait to go back. The Ramblas has some really good pickpockets so be sure to leave valuables in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: gm1962
Reviews.Content: This is a budget hotel. There is no getting around that point. My wife and I were travelling with our 17 year old (6'4" tall) son. Our room was a triple consisting of a double bed and a single bed. This did not leave much room for anything else in the room. Storage consisted of a small exposed rack and nothing else. Actually, this didn't present a huge problem as the airline lost our luggage so we had nothing really to store for most of the time we were there! Our room did not face a street, but was a little noisy from other guests coming and going. All of that said, the room was spotlessly clean as was the bedding and bathroom. The window we had opened and so we are able to get fresh air into the room, which is always a plus. The front desk staff were excellent, always approachable and helpful with advice and information (very handy when you have no luggage and need to shop urgently!) The HUGE plus for this hotel is the location. When they say it's on Las Ramblas, they mean it's ON it! It is at the top end of Las Ramblas and only a very short walk from the aerobus (airport bus) stop in Plaza de Catalunya. If you are into the hop-on hop-off tourist bus systems, both major companies have their main terminal even closer to the hotel, also in Plaza de Catalunya. Just in behind the hotel is a maze of twisting small alleys and streets filled with reasonably priced tapas bars and cafes. (Just a small plug - a real favourite of our family was La Ginesta at Jovellanos, 3 - a great tapas bar with friendly staff). Overall, accepting that this is a budget hotel, we rated it very highly and would have no hesitation in recommending it to other travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel. Great location.”
Reviews.Author: SaleDamc
Reviews.Content: I stayed here last week and the overiding reason was the fact that it was right on the Ramblas. I had room 107 which had some full length windows which opened out to a very small balcony overlooking the Ramblas - couldn't get a better location. The hotel itself is perfectly fine and it was very clean. To reach reception you do have to go up a fligh of very narrow stairs so, with no lift, it can be a struggle for those with heavy bags or mobility problems. The guys behind the desk were efficient, without being over-friendly and when I had my wallet stolen (the pickpockets are rife and very clever) they gave me information about police stations, where I could get money transferred as well as general information about the city. My room was very small with limited storage space but it was clean. The bathromm was very clean and the shower was good with plenty of hot water. There was a TV in the room but with no English channels. The breakfast was quite disappointing with just some cereal, pots of yoghurt, bread and criossants with packs of butter and jam. The coffee was dispensed from a machine and was OK but not the best I have had. There was free internet access and there are 2 vending machines where you can gets cans of drink, sandwiches and bars of chocolate etc.. Overall the hotel is pretty good and as a single guy I would have no hesitation in going back - especially at 45 euros a night, given it's location. Tip: Please beware of the pickpockets. I spent most of the time walking round with my hands in my pocket but last Saturday night, around the Placa de George Orwell area, I was distracted by 2 guys, for no more than 10 seconds and they were off, with my wallet. 1 guy pretended to bump into me and when I went to push him away another guy puts a leaflet in your hand, advertising a bogus dancing bar. The few seconds you are off guard is all they need and they disappeared down an unlit side street so I thought better of chasing them. If you have not been to Barcelona before then I will not lie and say that pickpockets are rare because it is a problem but I would still advise you to go as it is a fantastic city. This was my sixth visit and this incident was the first time anything has happened and I will certainly go back there.

Reviews.Title: “Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: cbf2897
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Hotel Lloret for 4 nights in Sep 10. Was down to two choices between Hotel Jazz and Lloret. Chose Lloret in the end cos i wanted to experience the buzz of staying on the most famous rambla in Barcelona although Jazz was much more elegant and beautiful (from the outside). Didnt regret the choice. It was certainly fun to be able to look out from my room and see all the people walking on the ramblas. The many buskers on the street certainly made it interesting too! Room - The room onlooking the street (extra 20euros i think) however, was really what u will expect for the price which u pay. Cheap price means reasonable room with reasonable facilities. The free wifi was a plus! Surrounding amenities - little cafes beside the hotels, which really are targeting the tourists with their relatively expensive but not so good food. The subway is just 1min walk away. There are shopping to be done all long la ramblas. Conclusion - If u want to experience Barcelona with a limited budget, this is certainly the place to go.

Reviews.Title: “A good time”
Reviews.Author: kgb101
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Hotel Lloret Barcelona as a gift from our daughter for Christmas. It is located about 50 yards from the start of the Rambles the hive of activates plenty of shops bars and restaurants. The hotels is very clean and tidy the staff very friendly we had a room on the second floor overlooking the Rambles with small balcony, there was a TV, Wardrobe, desk bed side cabinets, the bed was comfy and full bathroom. The hotel was a long room at the end of the reception where breakfast was severed, also free vending machine for hot drinks, and a rest room with TV a vending machines for cold drinks and snacks. There is use of the free computer for internet access. Because it is a city that never sleeps the noise from outside can be heard in room something is going on all the time but this did not stop us enjoying the break.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Barcelona!”
Reviews.Author: enriquebarton
Reviews.Content: The location of Hotel Lloret is definitely one of the best infront of Las ramblas and we believe it offer sa great value to the guests. For everyone who wants to go shopping a perfect location - just one block away The Plaza Cataluna. Pricewise it's just perfect and for the money you pay it's really an excellent option. The front desk service was great. We were very excited to find this hotel in such close proximity to Las Ramblas area. The hotel is small, but very clean and decently priced. We had a room with a nice sized bathroom and window infront of Las Ramblas. The hotel is within walking distance of a lot of really great things, including the famous Boqueria Market, etc and more We recomend this hotel to anyone who wants to be in Barcelona in an excellent location for an affordable price and attended by a very nice staff.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: vieira222
Reviews.Content: The location can’t be better, in the middle of La Rambla! And the receptionists are really helpful and polite. Rooms are small but very clean… and hot (something very appreciated in the middle of winter). Just one point: the shower in the toilet is very strong and water goes everywhere but we just had a laugh at it. The only drawback is the noise at night during weekends so bring a good pair of ear plugs ;-)

Reviews.Title: “Value for Money. Killer Location!”
Reviews.Author: Fluorescence
Reviews.Content: Although i stayed here only for 1 night, i should have stayed here for the entire duration of the trip. This hotel is right on La Rambla & 4 buildings away from Cafe Zurich. It is a 1 minute walk from the most happening district in Barcelona. I would highly recommend this hotel for the location. and i got it at a great price of 52 euros for 1 night including breakfast. there is also free Wi-Fi which works well throughout the hotel! Although the single room was small with a small bathroom, it was alright for the price & was comfortable enough. And to my surprise it was surprisingly quiet even on a saturday night. Its a steal for the price & totally worth it

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Izzybtizzy
Reviews.Content: Just back from a week at this hotel. Excellent location, clean, continetal breakfast good, air-con available, daily maid service. Would recommend

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Reception Staff & Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Maypole01
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through octopus travel so when we arrived at the hotel we handed the booking conformation over to Jack on reception but there was no record of our booking. The hotel was fully booked & there was a festival on when we were there so rooms were scarce but with Jacks help we were able to sort it out & our booking was found (it was under a totally different name) & it was an error on Octopus travel part. Jack was amazing & really friendly & helpful & called London for us. We got our room. The location of the hotel is great for everything you need. It isn't if you want a quiet night but if you don't then it is great. The rooms are clean & tidy as well. If you go here tell Jack the couple that bought him a beer say Hi! A little Barcelona tip also go to the market & get some fresh fruit & juice drinks as they are great

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, but...”
Reviews.Author: Calgary68
Reviews.Content: The Lloret does have a great location - right on La Rambla, close to the Aerobus stop in Placa Catalunya. But. The rooms are small (not unusual in downtown Anywhere, Europe) and in real need of updating. The breakfast is nothing special but certainly not the worst in our 3 week trip. What can you say about a hotel whose asset is its location?

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, clean, friendly and good value”
Reviews.Author: Naomiemb3
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this Hotel on 3 occasions in the last 2 years. Rooms aren't palacial but have all the necessary facilities and in any event you don't go to Barcelona to live in your Hotel room. The staff are friendly and there is a decent Continental type breakfast. The location is superb - easy access for Airport bus, local buses and the Metro. I can recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: LaceyDee
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a great location on the main strip of las ramblas, the hotel itself is very basic but very clean. Staff were all nice and helpful, breakfast were basic cereal, toast, yogurt but were nice, especially if eaten on the balcony. It made a great base for everything, the beach, gotti area and all sight seeing you would want to do. This hotel just needs a lick of paint to the reception area and also the room where the computer is. Some fresh colours, current colour scheme of the hotel is very dowdy which is a shame as this is the only thing wrong with the hotel. Also bathrooms could do with brightening up. If they did this it would more than boost its hotel star rating!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent - Hotel & Location”
Reviews.Author: carsondalton
Reviews.Content: Ola - In all honestly, i knew Hotel Lloret was situated on the Ramblas but it was a plesant shock , when we arrived to note that it was actually 'on the Ramblas'. The rooms are clean and comfortable, staff were very plesant and the breakfast for just 5 Euros was a steal. You can access just about anything from the hotel, close to the Aero Bus, the HOHO busses, the underground and the habour front. The Broqueria market and Carrefour express are just a stone's throw away. The internet connection is available for free with one terminal and that is a real wlecome. There is an a service area near the reception where one can sit, eat, read the papers or just watch life pass you buy on the Ramblas. The only weak spot is about the entrance, as one enters you have to waslk up afew stairs which is not easy with luggage etc. I will definately stay there again and recommend even families with kids.

Reviews.Title: “little gem on the ramblas”
Reviews.Author: cosmooo
Reviews.Content: what a great find...right in the middle of all the action barcelona has to offer. Getting to the hotel was so easy-the Aerobus stops about a minutes walk away from the hotel.With Placa Catalunya and and the metro station so close everything is extremly accessible. The hotel was clean and comfortable. the man at the front desk was very helpful and friendly. I checked at other hotels nearby and the rates were much higher than Lloret... Breakfast is simple but good...I guess this is a hotel for you if all you want is a great convenient location with no frills but you dont want to sacrifice cleanliness and comfort.Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “One of the warmest and most comfortable hotel I have ever been to, and I am a world traveller!”
Reviews.Author: eleonora1959
Reviews.Content: This charming little hotel in the heart of Barcelona is so well located, that when my friends and I stayed there for about 3 weeks last december, we never ran out of things to do just at walking distance! The hotel is very clean and very cozy, and the staff is extremely friendly and helpful. Breakfast was included and they have free internet for their guests. I recommend this hotel without hesitation to anyone who is thinking about visiting the city of Gaudi! Greetings from Australia, mates!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: trotamundo28
Reviews.Content: Location is just perfect so close to Plaza Cataluña, metro station, bus station to go to airport , Location is Excellent. Very clean The attention at the reception is friendly and helpful, in several languages (English, French, Italian, Portuguese, German, Dutch) the price-quality is good too. Nice breakfast at the hotel Many shopping areas very close. Good restaurants close to the Hotel Lloret, close to the Market, Beaches, Bus stops. I have visited Barcelona several times and I have always stayed at Hotel Lloret. I traveled always with my children and this hotel is just what I need.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience!”
Reviews.Author: enriquebarton
Reviews.Content: Excelent location on Las Ramblas. Very comfortable, clean, warm and cozy hotel. The staff was courteous, professional and very helpfull. Front desk and Housekeeping employees treated us like if we were at home. Rooms are very clean and comfortable. You can really tell that everyone loves working there and that really makes you feel at home. I recommend this hotel to people who wish to travel to Barcelona. Great value for the price!

Reviews.Title: “Basic accomodation at a very fair price.”
Reviews.Author: DezIsrael
Reviews.Content: Basic tidy clean room. Very good value at the price including ensuite bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Very spanish, very clean, very good location, no frills accommodation”
Reviews.Author: justmeander Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: As long as you are happy with basic, clean accommodation as a base for exploring Barcelona this is ideal. The twin room was basic and a little on the small side. The ensuite was also small but functional, both were spotlessly cleaned every day by a pleasant lady. The breakfast was fair value at 5 euro for bread, toast, fruit, cereal, tea/coffee etc. The location couldn't be better for roaming the sights but as it was on the vibrant Las Ramblas there was a fair amount of noise late into the evening. (nothing that a pair of ear plugs normally used to combat the wife's snoring didn't cure)

Reviews.Title: “Incredible location - great staff”
Reviews.Author: mboe
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel at the last minute based on Trip Advisor reviews; thank you, Trip Advisor. After booking for three nights we missed a train in Oviedo and could only get a night train to Barcelona - I called Hotel Lloret in a panic and the desk clerk was incredibly nice and did not charge us for the missed night. We came in tired the next morning and they had a room ready for us early. It's an old, quirky hotel with steep stairs up to the lobby level, and an ancient lift up to rooms from there. Our room was clean and comfortable for three. We had not expected to visit Barcelona and had no idea that La Rambla was one of the hot spots of Spain - it was amazing to walk down the street and see all of the street performers, musicians, and vendors. The St. Joseph Market, just south of the hotel, was one of the best markets we saw in all of Europe. We even ate breakfast there. Breakfast at the hotel was 5 Euros, which we didn't try, but it looked fine. Internet access was in the lobby, with plenty of comfortable chairs. Very friendly atmosphere. Yes, it was noisy at night, but don't expect to stay in a location like this without tolerating a little noise. My husband and son slept well the first night, but I bought a pair of earplugs and that solved the problem for me for the rest of the stay. Well worth it to be on La Rambla.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and cheap”
Reviews.Author: danish14
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 2 days. We got a room at the front of the hotel. We had a small balcony with a great view of La Rambla. It is a nice, cosey and clean hotel. If I have to say something, that is not so good, it will be, that we have to carrie the suitcase up about 15 steps because the elevator isn't at the frontdoor.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: carfin61
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 4 nights (Sunday to Thursday) with my elderly mother and we could hardly fault the place. When we arrived mid afternoon we were given keys to 2 rooms so that we could choose whether we wanted a room overlooking La Rambla or one at the back. We chose the one at the back because it was a bit bigger and the shower room was better. All the staff that we met were extremely friendly and helpful especially after my mother had her purse stolen whilst on the Metro on our first evening out. Pickpockets are a really serious problem in the city, take extra care especially in the Metro stations. The room was very well cleaned and tidied every morning, and although the rooms are basic we were a bit disappointed that there was no drawer space to put clothes and we had to stow our suitcases under the beds. Breakfast costs 5euro each but we did not try it because we always prefer to go to a patisseria and get fresh croissants which we take to a cafe to have with coffee. However the breakfast room always seemed very, very busy between 8am and 8.30. The lounge areas are small, but there is internet access, a large television, drinks machine and they have small tables and chairs out on the balconies, fantastic for sitting in the evening watching the hundreds of people walking up and down La Rambla, and we saw many entertainers right in front of us. The staff were happy to give us 2 glasses so we could have some wine while we sat on the balcony. The whole hotel has an 'old world' feel about it and the corridors and staircases in particular are very narrow (2 people cannot pass each other on the stairs to the rooms) and I would not recommend this hotel for families with very young children. If I'm ever in Barcelona again this is the place I will stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location on La Rambla”
Reviews.Author: Esperanto-uk
Reviews.Content: A great location if you want to be around La Rambla. Breakfast (Euro 5) was good, especially the coffee. Rooms were small but comfortable though the airconditioning faced directly onto the bed so it could become cold. Cava (Euro 2) & other drinks are sold in a vending machine and they supply the glasses. Just what you need after a day of sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and friendly service”
Reviews.Author: GalBanks
Reviews.Content: This place is a great budget hotel. It was far cheaper than any other hotel we could find with such an amazing location. The rooms and bathroom are kept very clean and had air con that worked fine. I'm always a bit worried about showers at cheaper hotels but it was really powerful! We stayed on the side street on the 2nd floor and while you could always hear people out in the street if the balcony door was open it was never a problem. And for people that moan about the noise. You are staying right on La Rambla, the heart of Barcelona's nightlife, you should be out there enjoying it! The staff are excellent and I'd definitely recommend this hotel to a friend.

Reviews.Title: “Love the place”
Reviews.Author: 1barcelona
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here 5 times over the past 15 years.It has up-graded some but still has the old Spanish mood. The rooms are small but adequet. If you stay in a room overlooking the Ramblas during summer months you will have an experience you never had. Music and dancing and mimes almost all night. It's great. Just request not to get and Triange rooms at the end of the building. The people who work their, all 24 hours a day, are Great. The breakfast is adaquet. If you need a big breakfast just look around. Worth the money as the more modern hotel just across the street is twicethe price. For me, I'll go back again and again. Steve Fisher USA

Reviews.Title: “Great budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: MarciaBrown
Reviews.Content: We didn't expect much for a budget hotel but found a hidden gem. The rooms were basic but adequate. When you stay in Barcelona, you don't spend much time in your room! All areas of the hotel were spotlessly clean and rooms serviced daily. Staff were friendly and helpful. All the reception staff spoke excellent English but indulged us in our attempts to speak Spanish. The best thing about the hotel is it's location at the northern end of La Rambla. It is in a safe area (we were two 'middle-aged' female travellers), easy to find, very close to public transport/tourist buses and many attractions are within walking distance. La Rambla can be a little noisy at night if you have a front-facing room but that's part of the atmosphere of Barcelona. If you want a 'quiet' holiday go to Eastbourne!

Reviews.Title: “bring earplugs if you stay in front or on the side”
Reviews.Author: Miser
Reviews.Content: The price was right, we had 6 double rooms, some located on the front, some on the side, a couple in the interior. The rooms on the front and side were awakened in the middle of night with a group of 20 or more drunk screaming people who had decided to hang out in the front and alley next to the hotel. Since we are seasoned travels, we turned on the a/c, put in the earplugs and went back to sleep. Request interior or rooms in the back of the hotel if you want to sleep through the night. Keep this in mind, we were there for one night during the middle of the week, I cannot even imagine what the noise level is like on the weekends. Rooms bathrooms were small, but fine for one night. Breakfast provided with the room was standard continental breakfast. A good value for your money in an expensive city, but remember to request rooms away from the front or side to get sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Dont go to this hotel!--By Steve Horton Merthyr Tydfil Wales UK”
Reviews.Author: STEVENSUEWalesUk
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a long weekend sat-tues. The location is great, right by the metro subway and 200 yards from the bus terminal. THATS THE GOOD POINTS OUT OF THE WAY! The rooms are dated but very clean and the television channels are in spanish only. The bathroom is adequate, but be aware the bath is very slippery and quite high so can be difficult for a shorty like my wife-----plus point-great powerful shower over the bath! We were unable to fully open the french doors to acess the balcony because it was chained, and we were unable to close the door fully due to the age and condition of the door and lock, this is where the main problem lies--NOISE! We have never stayed at such a noisey location before, on saturday night there were hundreds of people screaming, shouting and blowing whistles all night, and we mean all night until around 6am--QUIET on sunday night , then on monday groups of drunken locals who chose to sit on seats approx 15 yards from the hotel shouting, cat calling(making howling and stupid noises) again until around 6ish-no sleep again! One last thing breakfast is very very basic and not much availability, you can shop around and maybe get a deal but we think you will find the area mega expensive, 5 euros a pint of beer -3 euros for a tea or coffee, and the cost of eating out-forget about it! Also we couldnt find any entertainment during the evenings at all-BORING! One half decent bar is the VIENA situated approx 50 yards down the street from the hotel. OUR ADVICE IS TO GO TO A SEASIDE RESORT-MUCH CHEAPER AND VISIT BARCELONA TO SEE THE SIGHTS ON A DAY TRIP(BUSES AND TRAINS ARE FREQUENT AND CHEAP!)

Reviews.Title: “Swing a cat? . . . Not a chance!”
Reviews.Author: Misha J
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Lloret in December 08 and wow - what a surprise to walk into my "room". "Okay Mr Manager, this is a lovely broom closet - but could I see my room now please?" - he didn't seem to get my joke, not in Spanish nor English - but treated it as though he had heard it a few times before... and I bet my next holiday that he has! I am not saying that this is a horrible hotel by ay stretch of the imagination - but it is more of a hostel than hotel. Location: The location is absolutely fantastic. On La Ramblas, about 100 metres from Plaza de Catalonia - standing on your mini-balcony, you see all the life of this beautiful city below you. You hear the life of the city too - all the time. Still, staying in Spain - one needs to hear the noises to really soak up the life. Hearing a group of revellers at 3am on a week night reminds you that you are in a city that doesn't sleep and to live life to the fullest :) The room I was given was a triangle. I don't know if this is regular - but there were only three walls - with a door in one leading to the bathroom. The bathroom was no bigger than a double shower and contained a shower, toilet and vanity unit. At least once a day the electricity would go off from the water in the bathroom splashing onto the light globe above the sink. The concierge seemed used to this too. I got quite attached to our daily chat while he played with the fuse box and caught up on global news events. Your experience in a hotel like this isn't complete unless there are some faulty-towers moments. My only main disappointment was that none of the staff were called Manuel - but of course this being Catalunya, they were all called Jordi. Even the girls! :) The bedroom contained a single bed, and left enough room for my suitcase to sit on its side. I could, when lying on the bed flush against one wall, touch the other wall and the door. In my university days this would have been a god-send, but my flexibility and libido don't require such dimensions anymore so was a bit annoying and often made you feel claustrophobic when you wake suddenly in the night. The TV was on a bracket near the ceiling. There physically would have been no room for it on the floor. Not only could you not swing a cat in this room (first time I literally understood that saying) you could not spread your arms out at your side and spin - and a holiday isn't just a holiday unless you do some helicopter spins in your room in the morning! Considering that Barcelona is a city that doesn't sleep, and one spends more time in the tavernas and shops than they do in their rooms, it is really only a place to sleep, and hence not that bad. I personally like a bit of luxury and realised with a sudden shock when I entered the room that being frugal and thinking 'I could handle a cheaper place for a couple of days' was not so true. Next time its the Sofitel. Definitely not a place for couples or families - maybe only the budget conscious solo traveller would like this place. The breakfast was a watered-down version of the typical Spanish spread. Coffee only came from a self-service machine and the day-old bread was often 2 or 3 day old bread as the same baguette was on the table everyday. Still with numerous eateries in the area, this wasn't an issue at all. If you want to stay at this hotel - prepare yourself for a very small and no-frills experience. Do not expect a 5 star experience and remember you could not be more central in Barcelona if you tried. Focussing on its wondeful locale reminds you that it is not that big a deal. I am sure the hotel only remains in business because it is in such a great location. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very cleanliness, low price”
Reviews.Author: Tortuguitatrip
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at the hotel lloret the first thing that called the attention was the location , it´s just in the begining of la rambla next to Plaza Catalunya that is in the middle of the city center. We arrived by aerobus from the aeroport to the city center and it stops really close to hotel lloret. At the entrance of the hotel there are a few steps beafore you get to the elevator but it´s not a big deal. On the whole the attention was very frendly and polite The rooms are basic but in a good standard, and the cleanliness was excellent. In the lobby there was a wifi zone , and they also had a computer with internet connection. We were surprised that a hotel of these characteristics had these facilities. For us it was a really pleasant hotel experience most of all because of the location, the price and the cleanliness was very important to us. We would recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “we stayed in an apartment belonging to them”
Reviews.Author: rab87
Reviews.Content: We arrived there late at night it was the 1st hotel we visited, the man offered us an apartment for the night at an excellent rate, we were only planning on staying there for the 1st night as we have other accom. booked however we change our mind and stayed the week our apartment had a balcony which over looked the main plaza had a kitchen/living/dinning room in the one space and a room with 2singlebeds and 1double it was great, extremely clean,maybe a little basic for some people but my friends and I found it ecellent

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: worldwidevan
Reviews.Content: I have just stayed 9 nights there and this is a hotel of best value I have ever stayed. The location is impeccable, just 3 mins walk from the Catalunya Plaza and the metro station, 5 mins walk from the Aerobus station and 3 mins to the supermarket. The staff is very friendly and helpful. I have stayed in 5 star hotel and I must say the staff in Lloret is way better than the ones in the so-called upscale hotels. The room size is bigger than the business hotel in Japan and very clean. I find the washroom surprisingly spacious! The bed is very comfortable. Yes the room is a bit dated but it is pretty fair with its attractive rate. Just a tip for the noise issue, it seems that people will have party throughout the whole night (literally, till 6am) on Saturday. It was the noisiest night during my stay. (The rest is acceptable). If you are a problem sleeper, choose a room which is facing the side street rather than Ramblas.

Reviews.Title: “Greate Value if you are on budget...”
Reviews.Author: PMTexas
Reviews.Content: If you are short on money and want to have a place to sleep while in Barcelona, this is your hotel. It's very similar to La Quinta Inn chain in the U.S., but no continental breakfast (it's charge on the side). Website reservation worked like a charm for me. Front desk people is nice, speaks good English. The great value comes from the location, the best one ever: on the beginning of La Rambla, center of Barcelona's day and nightlife, It is also close to the city's major tourist attractions and just a few feet away from the subway station. Rooms are too small but clean. I felt like in New York every time I went to bed. It's prety noise at night too. If you have some difficulty to sleep, you will have a hard time. Last, but not least. Don't pay for the hotel breakfast. There are better options (and tasty ones) just around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “Great apartment”
Reviews.Author: fitz1NorthernIreland
Reviews.Content: We stayed at an apartment Hotel lloret had. It was down a side street off the main Las Rambles. Consisted of a kitchen which opened to a dining and living area. 1 double bedroom and another with 2 singles. Also had a balconey. Great location and value for money. very clean and compact

Reviews.Title: “Not too bad”
Reviews.Author: Greek_traveler999
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a 3 day stay at Barcelona. Going there for the Bread & Butter Barcelona trade show we were looking for something near the trade show. This was a right choice for us since the trade show was only a few metro stops from the hotel. The hotel is located on a busy street with a lot of shops, fast food restaurants and just a few meters from the metro station Catalunya. This was very helpful since we were going everywhere with the metro. And its is also very close to the bus station that goes to the airport (4.05 euros per person). Now the hotel is a really old hotel with not much to offer you but has some positive aspects. The positives: - The staff was really helpful, polite and were doing everything they can do to make your stay better. - They have a luggage room that you can leave your luggages until you check in. - The small living room with a fireplace and a pc was really cute. Many newspapers were available to read. A tv room was also there with a huge vending machine with all sort of foods and drinks (I don't know about the prices, I didn't use it). - The location as I said. Cloce to metro & bus station, shops, Burger King, Mc Donalds, super market, Hard Rock Cafe etc - The room was very clean. The negatives: - The room was really small with very old furniture and an ancient air condition system (even though I admit it was working like it was new). The room has nothing to do with the pictures on the hotel's internet site!!!!! - It was a little noisy but not too much (we had a room looking on the side street). That was all. In general it was a clean hotel that if you get it in good price and just use it only to sleep go for it. PS At the entrance of the hotel there are some stairs, so if you are using a wheelchair avoid it. PS 2 For some other advices I found helpful Rachie_babez 's review. Read it.

Reviews.Title: “Trying to book”
Reviews.Author: TPBX
Reviews.Content: Just wanted to warn other travelers trying to book with Hotel Lloret. I really wanted to stay here and went about trying to make a reservation online, but my card was not accepted for some reason, which I could not read as my Spanish is not very advanced. So I tried calling the hotel directly, only to have them hang up on me 3 times, leaving me very confused. The first time was quite possibly an honest mistake as I heard what I thought was an answering machine (I think it was the on-hold message), which I couldn't understand at all, so then I just kept saying 'hello' and I was hung up on. The two times I tried calling back straight after that, I said hello straight away and was still hung up on. I was quite disappointed after this, so perhaps try other methods of trying to book with the hotel if you really want to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect..!”
Reviews.Author: Rachie_babez
Reviews.Content: Well me and 2 friends have just come back from barcelona and after staying in this hotel - with the extremely helpful staff and wonderful cleaners! We shall definitely be returning! :-) We had 4 nights in hotel lloret in a triple room..admittidly it was a small room but it had 3 comfy beds, a nice power shower and air conditioning!! [ which was at no extra cost ] The majority of the staff speak good english and will be more than happy to help if you don't know the area very well or just want advice on good/reasonable restaurants. [TIP- bars and restaurants off la rambla are much cheaper and often nicer than ones directly on la rambla.] Being teenage girls well lets just say our room became instantly messy within 5 minutes off arriving.! The cleaners even folded our pyjama's up and put them under our pillows everyday! As well as replacing towels and thoroughly cleaning the bathroom and room.! The service hotel lloret provided far exceeded 2 star rating! Some general info about la rambla area of barcelona...if you are young and don't have the money or don't want to dine in restaurants there are plenty of supermarkets to buy ready made pastas/sandwiches and bageuttes. However if there is also a Subway, KFC, Macdonalds, Burger King along la Rambla. So your taste buds will be satisfied [sort of] as long as your'e not there for more than a week!! Admittedly we did dine on subways and the occasional KFC, however the 30 minute walk 4 times a day to port olympic and back solved the issue of piling on the pounds.!! The closest beach is barceloneta and is about a 30 minute walk straight down la rambla and left at the harbour..! [We refused to pay for taxis] The best clubs are at port olympic and most are free to get into just get talking to the right people :-) they chuck out mon-fri no later than 4am... BAD THINGS ABOUT THE HOTEL / HOLIDAY / BARCELONA 1] The hotel room had just one plug in the bathroom and one which the TV was plugged into..this was not helpful with 3 teenage girls getting ready to go out each night..!! 2] The taxi drivers WILL pile on extras for transfers to and from the airport..it should cost no more than 25euros as its only 20 minutes max away. We paid 35 on the way and just 25 on the way back...we agreed on a price with the driver before getting in on the way back!! You REALLY need to do this to avoid them conning you.! 3] Watch out for drug dealers / theives / protitutes there are LOADS up la rambla after about 1am. And it was a horrible experience having to dodge them on our way back every night. Some friends we made got totally mugged credit cards, money, watch the lot..and this is a common occurance. So BE CAREFUL! 4] As barcelona is a city expect to pay more for everything. Although soveniers are cheap. Drinks at clubs were a RIP OFF!! 30 euros for 3 vodka and oranges.!! Although some clubs were cheap - going down to around 24 euros... Despite this we all had a fantastic time and we really want to return to barcelona and maybe do a bit more sight seeing and shopping this time rather than just beach/clubbing..!!! Hope you find this helpful!!!

Reviews.Title: “What a PERFECT location!!!”
Reviews.Author: bigcheese88
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nice, the room was more than adequate. But the view of the Ramblas from the window was incredible!! It wasnt too noisy either. The hotel is towards the top of the Ramblas, it is quieter there and more upscale. I dont think I would want to stay in any other area than right there at the top of the Ramblas with that view and the access to everything a traveler could ever ask for!!! LOVED it!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: youngloulou
Reviews.Content: Hotel LLoret has a great location, just at the top of the Ramlas, right next to a metro station & 10 minute walk from the harbour. The Barcelona tourist bus stops 1 minute away. The rooms were basic & slightly shabby but clean & the beds were comfy. The breakfast was basic, croissants, bread, yoghurts & fruit but it was served till 11ish which meant we didnt have to drag ourselves out of bed too early! The only downside was that there was no bar & the floors are all tiled so when you're trying to sneak quietly back in at 4am your heals clatter a bit on the floor! I would def stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Basic but clean”
Reviews.Author: jeep_potter
Reviews.Content: Stopped here for 3 nights - Tue 20th Nov to Fri, Nov 23rd. Like most on here have said the hotel is basic but clean. It's main factor is location. The downside to the location is that at night it's like running a gauntlet back to the hotel. I must have been accosted by every prostitute in Barcelona!! It could have got a bit scarey if I'd been a timid person. Thankfully a polite "F*ck off" seemed to get the message over!!! I booked a single room through the hotel website. It cost 48 Euros per night which I thought was reasonable. The room was tucked away at the back of the hotel. It was quite small which I expected. The room was clean and the shower was powerful and hot. The air con was a bit too loud but I got over this by making sure I was drunk every night ;-) Overall, the Lloret is a hotel I would recommend to friends, etc and I'd prob stay there again if I couldn't get a better deal somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location - Skip the Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Belevy
Reviews.Content: I agree with most of the reviews - you cannot beat the location of this little gem for exploring the city. We stayed there for two nights in a room facing La Rambla. There's alot of activity going on into the night, but we had no issues with the noise. As soon as we closed the balcony doors, the noise level was manageable. Be aware that you will need to carry your bags up the first flight of stairs to the tiny elevator. From there you can put the bags into the elevator and go up a floor to the front desk /lobby area. Also, we spent the extra few dollars for the continental breakfast, despite some Trip Advisor reviews that recommended against that. Now I see why. The breakfast was terrible and not worth the money at all. There are so many other nicer places that serve breakfast right on La Rambla. Save your money for them. Also, don't be surprised that you need to turn in your key each time you leave the hotel and then pick it up on your return. It's just hotel policy. Overall, we found the rooms to be simple, but comfortable and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Great value hotel”
Reviews.Author: SanJosean
Reviews.Content: There were four of us who stayed in 2 rooms. We will definitely stay there again. For the price of 73 euros, it was well worth it. The location was great - right on La Rambla. We felt safe at all hours of the day. It was close to the metro and a couple of blocks from the Boqueria Marketplace. The rooms were basic and plain, but they were cleaned each day with new towels and made-up beds. We felt very comfortable. Although you do hear all the noise in the room from the street, it didn't bother any of us. It was a pleasant experience for our first trip to Barcelona. I recommend restaurants located on the alleys off La Rambla. The food are great and you get better prices than those off La Rambla. I highly recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, just remember it's a one-star hotel”
Reviews.Author: katacha
Reviews.Content: The best thing about the Hotel Lloret is its location right at the top of the Ramblas, near Plaza Catalunya. This puts you right between the Barri Gotic and L'Eixample, and right next to a major metro stop. Other positives include the friendly and helpful staff and the bathroom, which looked recently renovated. Also, the room price is relatively low for Barcelona.
