However, it's important to keep in mind that the Lloret is a one star hotel, and just an average one at that. Here are the negatives based on my recent trip there (I stayed 3 nights): -While the room was clean for the most part, there was a stain on my bedsheets and I did see a roach in our room the second night. That could have been a fluke, but it's never fun to have bugs in your room. -I was on the 2nd floor off Carrer Tallers (a side street) and even with the windows closed it was very noisy. I rarely have trouble falling asleep at night but I did here. Bring earplugs! -Skip the breakfast. It's bread with jam and butter and pastries from a box. Coffee from a machine, which was okay. You can get better for less at just about any cafe. If I go to Barcelona again, I will probably spend a little more to stay somewhere nicer. However, if you're looking for something cheap but nicer than a hostal, the Lloret is okay, and the location really can't be beat.

Reviews.Title: “Don't book the rooms at Rambla side”
Reviews.Author: LateSenior
Reviews.Content: The rooms facing Rambla are extremely noisy ones, around the clock. Please book the other rooms, do not pay the extra charge for having sleepless nigths!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location... Great Value”
Reviews.Author: etak74
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel after seeing that it was rated highly by single travellers. The hotel was in a fantastic location and the noise wasn't as bad as other reviews had suggested. I expected it to be noisy being right on La Rambla but the hotel is located at the top end so maybe it's not as bustly on this part. I has a single room and it was very tiny but enough for what I needed. If you plan on spending a long time in your room then it would have been too small but WHY would you want to do that...Barcelona is an amazing place with so much to see. The hotal was very clean and the staff were very friendly and helpful. Breakfast was good and cheap. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but loud!”
Reviews.Author: ktscott01
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Lloret for 3 nights and you cannot beat the rate for the location of the hotel. What you can beat is how loud the street noise is in the rooms. The best thing about the property is the location it is right at the top of Las Ramblas. We were able to walk or catch any bus to all the locations we visited. Check-in: Easy and quick. The clerk spoke many languages so we could practice Spanish and also German to check into our room. Rooms: They were not pretty but I also didn't feel I was staying in a dump. They were a bit dated but no worries. The biggest problem was the noise. There was no sound proofing. So there was someone down the hall watching TV and we could hear it perfectly. Also we could hear the person snoring in the next room. And at night the street noise was, I'm not kidding, the loudest I have ever heard in a hotel and we were on the top floor facing an alley. Bed: Below average bed. Not very comfortable for 3 nights. TV: It only got 5 channels so it was hard to find anything to watch. Even news. Bathroom: Everything worked fine and they have complementary soaps and shampoo. Checkout: Again quick and easy for our early morning departure for the airport. Overall it was a great location for the rate but it was so loud I think I'd look for another hotel in the area that isn't right on the main road and hopefully has thicker walls.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: pinktomato
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location at the top of La Ramblas - just a short walk from the airport bus. Room was a triple (1x double 1x single) which was smallish but absolutely clean and adequate for the amount of time we spent there. Shower was great. Reception staff were really helpful and spoke good English, German and French as well as the ubiquitous Spanish. We did have earplugs as suggested but this was more necessary due to air con than street noise. Free internet access and safety deposit boxes were readily available. All our party (Mum 64 and daughters in 30's) would definitely recommend this hotel and would go back if we go back to Barcelona again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: xy9999
Reviews.Content: We found out about this hotel from the tripadvisor website. The location is superb and right next to the La Rambla. We heard alot about the crime rate in that area however we felt safe and had no problem at all when walking around in the night/day. The hotel staff is friendly and nice. The hotel room is basic but very very clean. It has air conditioning which is a big bonus in this weather. However, be aware that the housekeeper may change the setting of the air con (i.e.turning the temp up) and there are no knobs to change the temp on the air con. But you can always use a bit of brain and reasonable force to change the setting, e.g. covering your finger with sock and turn it forcefully. In conclusion, it has been a pleasant stay.We will definately come back to stay in this hotel again and recommend this hotel to anyone!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Find”
Reviews.Author: westenders_vancouver
Reviews.Content: We found Hotel Lloret through TripAdvisor and were pleasantly suprised. It was a great deal compared to many other hotels in Barcelona. When we first arrived it was very easy to find and was right on the busy Ramblas. The room was a bit dingy at first glance but we quickly realized that it was extremly clean and had everything we needed. We had a room facing the side street. It was noisy but we brought ear plugs as per the other reviews and we slept just fine. We would recommend this to anyone looking for an affordable place to stay with a central location.

Reviews.Title: “Ideally Situated Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: excharger
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed a week in this hotel on the recommendation of her cousin who had lived in Barcelona. We weren't disappointed. It was a remarkable value for being in a prime location and having respectable facilities. We would definitely stay again. The hotel is located at the top of Las Ramblas, just a stones throw from the Placa de Catalunya. This made it easy for us to catch the Aerobus from the airport to the Placa for under 4 Euros a piece. This is a great location to branch out and explore Barcelona. You are within easy walking distance of the Barri Gotic. There are subway stops right on Las Ramblas. And tour buses stop a the plaza to take you to the main attractions. It's just a couple of blocks from Mercat dela Boqueria the main open air market which became a daily stop for us to pick up essential supplies like fresh bread, cured ham and salamis, olives, cheese and wine. The rooms are small and have minimal furnishings. However, the bed was comfortable and the room was clean. The desk staff was pleasant and helpful throughout our stay. The wifi didn't reach our room but there's a nice lobby area where you can connect and it has small balconies with tables and chairs that overlook the ever entertaining parade of Las Ramblas.

Reviews.Title: “Right on the Ramblas!”
Reviews.Author: elillamas
Reviews.Content: We booked a triple room with the Hotel Lloret and never did we think we would be right on the Ramblas street, that was a wonderful surprise! Our room had a double bed and a single bed for our son. The bathroom was a good size, the place was clean. Our room was not well insulated against hall traffic, whether it was people talking or walking. We could hear the people next to us trying to get their key in the slot and trying to figure out if it was the right floor and right room, but once in their room, we didn't hear them again. On the plus side of that, we hardly spent anytime in the room to be distrubed. The window in our room did not fit correctly into the frame, it was too small, you cold close one side, but the other stayed slightly open, thus never locking. We didn't worry though because we were on the 4th floor and if someone wanted to get in through here, they better be good acrobats! . We paid 81 euros per night and it did not include breakfast, but from my research on Barcelona, most hotels did not include breakfast in their room rates. If you want to be close to the metro, the shopping, restaurants, some of the sites in the downtown area, then this is a good location.

Reviews.Title: “Good Budget Option”
Reviews.Author: Dizzee
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, rooms small and in need of modernisation but clean. Ramblas view rooms are noisy at night but worth it for people-watching. Staff friendly and helpful. Would stay here again if on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Great palce to stay”
Reviews.Author: Juubeli
Reviews.Content: Great value for your money. Situated on las Ramblas, but cheaper than others nearby. Basic hotel with clean rooms w/ AC (a bit noisy) and friendly personnel.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away!”
Reviews.Author: robsLondon
Reviews.Content: We stayed there this weekend.... 10-11 March 07. Great location but thats about it! No hot water in our room and also impossible to get to sleep with the noise on the street. Breakfast is dry bread and yoghurt! Dont really know if this place even deserves its one star. No staff anywhere to be seen at all which didnt help when we realised we had no hot water. There are loads of other hotels on Las Ramblas... try one of them x

Reviews.Title: “great price for location!”
Reviews.Author: EmersonMonty
Reviews.Content: right on la rambla, so you're in the thick of the action. great as long as you don't mind noise when trying to go to sleep at night. we booked a room facing a side street(a few bucks cheaper and, i would imagine, less noisy) and it was still a bit loud. just bring earplugs. folks at the reception were super-nice. the room is not as small as we've had in other places. the bathroom was always sparkly. i love that the floors (room and bath) are all tile... definitely better than carpet, which always seems to be suspiciously damp in other budget hotels. this ain't the ritz, but definitely above-average for the price (we paid 75euros/night for twin). also very very convenient if you're coming from the airport. the aerobus stop is just a 3 minute walk.

Reviews.Title: “I think it's a great deal for the price”
Reviews.Author: YeeLyn
Reviews.Content: Hotel Location - can't be in a better location. It is right at the tip of La Ramblas, and the moment you get out of Metro - Placa Cantalunya, it's just within 1 min walk. It faces the main street and not in the small lanes, so at night, you can hang out at the balcony to people-watch & listen to free music by the baskers. Carrefour is next door only, so quite convenient to get water, groceries etc.. Room - is small but clean. Was a single traveller, and did not require such a big room. For the price I paid, felt it was pretty reasonable - with own toilet, wardrobe, dressing table & TV. Noise - May be quite noisy at night, but quite bearable. Before staying at Hotel Lloret, i put up at a 4* hotel nearby and the noise was worse! After all the activities in the day, u end up so tired, so no problem falling asleep. Breakfast - They serve bf daily from 7-11am at 5Euro. Pastries, bread, cereals, coffee, milk, juice & fruits. spread is not fantastic but what do you expect with 5Euros.. I find it OK. Living Room - There is a comfortable area with red sofa, plasma TV, fireplace for people to hang around near the reception. If you think your room is too small & clastrophobic, this is one good place to hang out & surf internet. Overall, i think this is a good place for single travellers or travellers on tight budget.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Nice & Friendly”
Reviews.Author: debarooo
Reviews.Content: Was a bit worried when we pulled up in the taxi as all you could see what the front door to the hotel. and 1st impressions were scary. However once we got in the place and was met by the reception staff, found the hotel to quant, small and full off character. We actually found this hotel in the rough guide to Barcelona and was everything we expected as the guide was very open and honest about this hotel, so there were no nasty surprises. Although situated on top of the Rambla's the noise was a little loud to begin with and yes we had forgotten the ear plugs, but it was easy to forget about and once asleep. Breakfast was lovely, yet cheap, it can be expensive if eaten on the Rambla, but you really couldn't complain @ 3 euros each. In all found this to be quiet a charming hotel, it was clean and tidy and although only there for 4 nights, I would recommend this to anyone, especially considering the price was so cheap for the time of year and it;s location.

Reviews.Title: “Frendly stuff”
Reviews.Author: Garinca
Reviews.Content: I visited BCN with couple of friends two times this year - first in May /5 days/ and than in August /3 days/.Both times We stayed in Lloret hotel.Rooms are indeed basic and small but spotless. Breakfast- fine: fruit juices, several kinds of coffee, pastry, butter, fruit salad,Yogurt...Do not expect various offer. I find this hotel very convinient for budget travelers and young people. Great location. Only 100m from Plaza Catalunia where is the bus stop for special airport bus-costs only 4E. So its easy to get to and from the airport. It can be noisy by night- but hey-you are in the main pedestrian street.Stuff great- helpfull and friendly.So if you want a quite night rest- go elsewhere or ask for room that has not Ramblas view. But if you are in Barcelona for sightseeing, fun you dont have a lot of money-this hotel is a right choice.Metro is just great! Open till 01am-covering all city, so no need to use taxi at all.Dont miss Gaudi masterworks, Piccaso museum, Huan Miro foundation and Barceloneta beach. Imprtant note:use direct hotel web site [--] for reservation- in that way you will get secure reservation confirmed by e mail.They will note charge your credit card- only 1 night rate if you do not cancel on time or do not come at all. Othervise they will charge you when you check out. Have fun in BCN!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and price - clean and friendly”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our family of 15 stayed at Hotel Lloret in July 2006 and had a good experience. The rooms were small and basic but the price was right. It was clean and safe while with a staff that was polite and helpful. You can't beat the location on La Rambla next to the Metro, bus to the airport and tour buses. The hotel also has an elevator and air conditioning which is something to consider in the summer. Also, the front desk can communicate in basic english which helped those of us who didn't speak much spanish. One note of caution - if you get a room on the front side, you may get some noise on popular nights. My sister and husband were on the front side the night of the World Cup finals and didn't get to sleep until after 2PM. Most of us requested a back side room and didn't have any problems. PS Mind your wallet and passports in BCN. My brother in law had his back back stolen at a street side bar in a scam where he was distracted by one while the other stole the back pack. He had to get a new passport at the American Consolate and said the place was packed with Americans with similar stories.

Reviews.Title: “As expected”
Reviews.Author: Carolyn73
Reviews.Content: Well, after reading the reviews before booking we packed ear plugs, and needed the them!! The rooms were very clean but a bit dated, small by US standards but not for europe. We had a balcony which overlooked La Ramblas, great for people watching but not for sleeping, fortunatuly we had packed ear plugs and eye masks which came in usefull. The staff were very helpful and we were able to store our luggage after we checked out on the last day FOC. Barcelona is a great city to walk around, didn't use a cab once. Will definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't Stay Here Again”
Reviews.Author: pcintx
Reviews.Content: Stayed three days recently. As mentioned in other reviews, the hotel is clean as a whistle and the location is right on the Ramblas. But the room was so small that the two of us had to take turns moving around, and the noise from the Ramblas was excessive. Believe me, we were not expecting a luxury hotel, but this was just too small a room. We will stay in the Old City Center (Barri Gotic) area the next time. Just as easy to get to the Ramblas and all points, much more charm, and you don't pay the price for being on the Ramblas.

Reviews.Title: “Second visit - still great”
Reviews.Author: Honey510
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Barcelona, where I stayed at the Hotel Lloret again. You really can't knock the location and yet again the staff were very helpful and cheerful. Please don't expect anything fantastic, the rooms are very small and basic (yet immaculate, as always) but it really is the perfect base from which to explore the city.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, very clean and would stay there again”
Reviews.Author: Snooter
Reviews.Content: Just returned 12th March 2006 after 3 nights in the Hotel Lloret in Barcelona. Excellent location and very clean. Staff helpful. It is an old building, with marble steps that dipped in the middle taking you up to the reception desk. Room small but very clean and bathroom spotless. We had a double room with balcony facing over Las Ramblas. Noisy but full of atmosphere. Hotel easy to find when airport bus terminates at the Placa de Catalunya. Good value for money. Don't expect a 4 star, red carpet hotel. You don't spend much time in the room so enjoy the atmosphere and get good value for money. Wouldn't hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly suprised”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Moved into this hotel after leaving hotel we booked on the internet. This hotel is a little dated, but rooms are very clean and relatively spacious. Balcony opened to a side street and it was very noisy when we left the balcony door open. Staff is very friendly and the vibe at the hotel is good. Spacious lobby and dining room with cute balcony tables that you can sit at overlooking the Ramblas. Location is a block from Catalonia Plaza, at the top of the Ramblas.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: A simple hotel with character and a geat location! The staff are extremely friendly and very helpful (having arrived a day late my room had been cancelled but they offered me a double room at no extra charge). As for breakfast, go to the small dingy tapas bar around the corner. It may be full of old men drinking beer at 8 o'clock in the morning but let me tell you, they make the best chorizos and coffee. Anyway, a good, simple ,affordable hotel. You may think the rooms are a tad small but the location makes up for it....Book Now!!!!!! ps- If you don't mind a little noice ask for a room with a balcony. pps-When you arrive use the stairs to go to reception...the lift does not go to the ground floor.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family and I greatly enjoyed our stay at Hotel Lloret...we actually got an apartment room for 90 euros, with a small balcony overlooking the Ramblas....we saved a lot of money staying here, as we could cook in the room..and it was very centrally located...the metro is a breeze in Barcelona Highly recommended...Enjoy your stay...
